item.title: #en @ 1450510624719519744
item.description: TY @GovKathyHochul for signing the MTA Open Data act. W/ todayâ€™s signing, the MTA will have to make its data available to the public & easy to manipulate. This will make the MTA more accountable to the millions of NYers who rely on subways/buses to go about their daily lives. https://t.co/1ToWZiagaK

item.title: #en @ 1450509854771236871
item.description:
Brokerages should have tax optimized orders
Put in your desired trade and the brokerage will figure out the tax-optimal way to get the same exposure, closing the trade when you hit long-term cap gains or otherwise specified
W open data, easy to bring to on-chain DEXs

item.title: #en @ 1450494068065247243
item.description:

I'm interested hourly ridership to assess how peak load curves have shifted--it's essential for future fare policy & service evaluation https://t.co/dFbqxuxNeZ

item.title: #en @ 1450295959309721600
item.description: @Win_OpenData @jenni_pro I don't suggest applying based on pressure. But, I do suggest applying to jobs that you think you may want to pursue. Yes, you are being interviewed, but you are also interviewing them. The process of applying to a job can help you decide if you truly want it.

item.title: #en @ 1450164418516561931
item.description:
It ought to be simple: if you run a train *anywhere* on *any track* in EU, you have to make all - timetable data - ticketing data - live running data available in an open data format, for a fair price
That'd be the single step that'd make the biggest change to cross border rail https://t.co/sdn9L5G3xY

item.description:
.@UNDataForum is over but the spirit of moving from "what" to "how" lives on. My points in @OpenDataWatch blog:

item.title: #en @ 1449705257634701313
item.description: And suddenly all the connecting work - all the relational trail making - took a serendipitous turn. And I was reminded yet again that the point of open data is not to interconnect records but to provide the conditions for opening ourselves to each other. [end]
